definitions.definition: A group or bunch of several discrete items that are close to each other.
definitions.example: A cluster of flowers grew in the pot.

definitions.definition: A number of individuals grouped together or collected in one place; a crowd; a mob.
A group of galaxies or stars that appear near each other.
definitions.example: The Pleiades cluster contains seven bright stars.

definitions.definition: A sequence of two or more words that occur in language with high frequency but are not idiomatic; a chunk, bundle, or lexical bundle.
definitions.example: examples of clusters would include "in accordance with", "the results of" and "so far"

definitions.definition: A secundal chord of three or more notes.

definitions.example: The word "scrub" begins with a cluster of three consonants.

definitions.definition: A group of computers that work together.
A logical data storage unit containing one or more physical sectors (see block).
A significant subset within a population.
A small metal design that indicates that a medal has been awarded to the same person before.
An ensemble of bound atoms or molecules, intermediate in size between a molecule and a bulk solid.
To form a cluster or group.
definitions.example: The children clustered around the puppy.
